title.native: ブルーアーカイブ The Animation

description:
The anime will adapt the "Countermeasures Committee" arc.

The city's academies are divided into their own districts and are considered mostly independent.

The General Student Council acts as governing board to manage the academies as a whole. However, the group's ability to govern has come to halt since the mysterious disappearance of the General Student Council president. Countless issues have begun to surface throughout Kivotos in the absence of the president's leadership.

To avoid disaster, the General Student Council requests assistance from the Federal Investigation Club, otherwise known as Schale. In fact, Schale is the city's newest club and the last to be approved before the president's disappearance.

To accomplish its task, Schale relies on the guidance of a Sensei who can help them resolve the incidents around Kivotos.

(Students are required to carry personal weapons and smart phones! Get a taste of the military action, love, and friendship the Academy City has to offer!)

(Source: Anime News Network, Nexon, edited)

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Feet
tags.description: Features the sexual depiction or stimulation of a character's feet.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

**Daigo Yamagishi** is a Japanese director, episode director, production manager and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/98020267)

Yamada graduated from the Department of Literature at Keio University. While attending the university he was in the same year as the Macross character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/) and creator [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/), both of which where the first people he collaborated with in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088//). This marked the start of his scriptwriting career.

__[Website](https://www.inametoru.com/) | [Blog (JP)](http://40meter.blog125.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/40mP) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/40meterP)__

__40meterP__, better known as 40mP, or alternatively known by alias Iname Tooru, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, arranger, composer, producer and illustrator. He uses the name 40mP when doing VOCALOID music composition, production and illustration, while as a singer-songwriter he uses the name Iname Tooru. 

His works usually exceed 100,000 views in average. His most popular songs are "Karakuri Pierrot" and "Ren'ai Saiban", both achieving over 10M views. He has produced the most #1 songs on the Weekly VOCALOID Ranking, with 27 songs. He also holds the record for the most songs to enter the Hall of Fame, with a total of 76 works. This producer has released work in the VOCALOID-P data series.

__[Website](https://www.inametoru.com/) | [Blog (JP)](http://40meter.blog125.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/40mP) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/40meterP)__

[Profile (tomorrow jam)](https://tomorrowjam.jp/talent/hanamori-yumiri/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hanayumi09) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yumiri_Hanamori) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花守ゆみり)


**Non anime roles:**
- Mercedes von Martritz - Fire Emblem Three Houses (Video Game)
- NEKO#ΦωΦ - Muse Dash (Video Game)
- Yanfei - Genshin Impact (Video Game)
- Delta - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (Video Game)
- Lantern - Honkai Impact 3rd (Video Game)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ayakaohashi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayaka_ohashi/)

A voice actor, singer, and the drummer of [Poppin'Party](https://anilist.co/staff/153185/PoppinParty). Ayaka was born in Saitama Prefecture but moved to Tokyo after kindergarten. She became part of a theater company in elementary school and appeared in commercials, stage productions, and TV dramas. After receiving some voice acting lessons in the company, she realized that she wanted to become a voice actress. She got scouted in 2011 by Horipro and began her career. In August 2014, she debuted as a singer with her single "YES!!", which was used as the opening theme for the anime _Sabagebu!_.

Her hobbies includes karaoke as well as watching anime, drumming, browsing the internet, gaming, watching sports, and reading light novels. She had drumming skills prior to joining the _Bang Dream_ franchise. Ayaka loves heavy metal and shares her love together with her mother, who used to sing Marilyn Manson's songs for her as lullabies. Her favorite bands are Evanescence, Papa Roach, and Slipknot. She also admires [Nana Mizuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95081/). 

Ayaka is also the voice provider of the VOCALOID4 voicebank, MATCHA.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Iansan - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Angelina - Arknights (VG)

**Height:** 150 cm

[Website](http://www.ogurayui.jp) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/ogurayui-0815) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/OY_A_Official) | [Twitter (Personal)](https://twitter.com/yui_ogura_815) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjoIKN4CybsJyv0pWwAUJ5w) | [LINE](https://lineblog.me/ogurayui) | [Clare Voice](http://clare-voice.co.jp/talent) | [YuiKaori](http://www.yuikaori.info) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/27839.html) | [Wikipedia](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B0%8F%E5%80%89%E5%94%AF) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yui_ogura_official) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@yui_ogura_offcial)

Not to be confused with [Yui Ogura (小倉結衣)](https://anilist.co/staff/123771).

Yui Ogura is an idol, actress, singer and voice actress (seiyuu) affiliated with Clare Voice. She is one of four members in Team Dekaris along with Kaori Ishihara, Arisa Noto, and Maho Matsunaga. She was one half of J-Pop duo [YuiKaori](https://anilist.co/staff/195974/), along with [Kaori Ishihara](https://anilist.co/staff/105217/) before the group disbanded in 2017. She is a former member of the seiyuu group [StylipS](https://anilist.co/staff/111177/), which was formed in 2011 and composed of the same members of Team Dekaris. Ogura's debut single "Raise" was released on July 18, 2012. She graduated from the group in April 2013.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Amatsukaze - Kancolle (VG)
- Taigei/Ryuuhou - Kancolle (VG)
